data.title: Ohio Northern University
data.meta_description: Ohio Northern University is a higher education institution located in Hardin County, OH. In 2022, the most popular Professional Doctorate concentrations at Ohio Northern University were Pharmacy (127 degrees awarded) and Law (41 degrees).
data.text:
In 2022, the cost of tuition at Ohio Northern University was $35,480. The cost of tuition at Ohio Northern University is $7,150 more than than the overall (public and private) national average for Baccalaureate Colleges ($28,330).

In 2022 Ohio Northern University had an average net price — the price paid after factoring in grants and loans — of $27,398. Between 2021 and 2022, the average net price of Ohio Northern University grew by 9.57%.

The average yearly cost of room and board at Ohio Northern University was of $10,924 in 2022. The cost of room and board increased by 1.12% between 2021 and 2022.

During the same period, the average yearly cost of books and supplies was $1,800. The cost of books and supplies did not change during the same period.

88% of undergraduate students at Ohio Northern University received financial aid through grants or loans in 2022. This represents a decline of 6.38% with respect to 2021, when 94% of undergraduate students received financial aid.

The average award discount is the ratio between the average grant or scholarship value, and the cost, which is the sum of out-of-state tuition, room, board, book, supplies, and other expenses.

In 2019 the default rate for borrower's at Ohio Northern University was 1.17%, which represents 8 out of the 685 total borrowers.

A cohort default rate is the percentage of a school's borrowers who enter repayment on certain Federal Family Education Loan (FFEL) Program or William D. Ford Federal Direct Loan (Direct Loan) Program loans during a particular federal fiscal year (FY), October 1 to September 30, and default or meet other specified conditions prior to the end of the second following fiscal year.

In 2022, the undergraduate acceptance rate of Ohio Northern University was 54.4% (3,602 admissions from 6,625 applications). This is lower than the acceptance rate of 2021, which was 68.9%. Between 2021 and 2022, the number of applicants grew by 27.3%, while admissions grew by 0.446%.

This chart compares the acceptance rate of Ohio Northern University (in red) with that of other similar universities, and the chart below shows the acceptance rate by gender.

The following chart shows the average SAT scores for the 25th, 50th, and 75th percentile of applicants for each section of the test that they are evaluated on.

The total enrollment at Ohio Northern University in 2022, both undergraduate and graduate, is 3,015 students. The full-time enrollment at Ohio Northern University is 2,807 and the part-time enrollment is 208. This means that 93.1% of students enrolled at Ohio Northern University are enrolled full-time compared with N/A% at similar Baccalaureate Colleges.

Retention rate measures the number of first-time students who began their studies the previous fall and returned to school the following fall. The retention rate for full-time undergraduates at Ohio Northern University was 80%. Compared with the full-time retention rate at similar Baccalaureate Colleges (72%), Ohio Northern University had a retention rate higher than its peers.

The enrolled student population at Ohio Northern University is 78.6% White, 4.68% Two or More Races, 3.15% Black or African American, 1.92% Asian, 0.431% Hispanic or Latino, 0.265% Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islanders, and 0.199% American Indian or Alaska Native. This includes both full-time and part-time students as well as graduate and undergraduates. By comparison, enrollment for all Baccalaureate Colleges is 54.3% White, 13.8% Hispanic or Latino, and 13.1% Black or African American.

Any student who is studying in the United States on a temporary basis is categorized as a "Non-Resident Alien", and the share of those students are shown in the chart below. Additionally, 259 students (8.59%) did not report their race.

The most common jobs for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Ohio Northern University are Software developers (500,561 people), Other managers (424,195 people), Miscellaneous engineers, including nuclear engineers (380,856 people), Civil engineers (289,125 people), and Postsecondary teachers (225,166 people).

The highest paying jobs for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Ohio Northern University are Podiatrists, Cardiovascular technologists and technicians, Surgeons, Physicians, and Securities, commodities, & financial services sales agents

The most common industries for people who hold a degree in one of the 5 most specialized majors at Ohio Northern University are Computer Systems Design (564,763 people), Architectural, engineering & related services (476,340 people), Colleges, universities & professional schools, including junior colleges (426,714 people), Elementary & secondary schools (348,961 people), and Construction (333,079 people).

In 2022, 334 degrees were awarded to men at Ohio Northern University, which is 1.1 times more than the number of degrees awarded to females (303).

In 2022, 59% of students graduating from Ohio Northern University completed their program within 100% "normal time" (i.e. 4 years for a 4-year degree). Comparatively, 71% completed their degrees within 150% of the normal time, and 72% within 200%.

Graduation rate is defined as the percentage of full-time, first-time students who received a degree or award within a specific percentage of "normal time" to completion for their program.

The student demographic with the highest graduation rate in 2022 at Ohio Northern University is Male and Two or More Races (100% graduation rate). Across all Baccalaureate Colleges, Asian Female students have the highest graduation rate (73.2%).

The department of education defines graduation rate as the percentage of full-time, first-time students who received a degree or award within 150% of "normal time" to completion.

The National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) categorizes any student who is studying in the United States on a temporary basis as a "Non-Resident Alien", and the graduation rate of those students is shown in the chart below. Additionally, 6.93% of graduates (21 students) did not report their race.

The most common race/ethnicity at Ohio Northern University is white (490 degrees awarded). There were 21.3 times more white recipients than the next closest race/ethnicity group, black or african american (23 degrees).

The most common race/ethnicity and sex grouping at Ohio Northern University is white male (257 degrees awarded). There were 1.1 times more white male recipients than the next closest race/ethnicity group, white female (233 degrees).

In 2022, Ohio Northern University paid a median of $38.1M in salaries, which represents 37.9% of their overall expenditure ($101M) and a 1.93% decline from the previous year. This is compared to a 1.94% growth between 2020 and 2021, and a 3.51% decline between 2019 and 2020.
